item.title: Only Britain Fails to Soldier On
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230209 - Only Britain Fails to Soldier On.mp3
item.description: There's a rumor circulating that Liz Truss may be making a comeback. Well, she might think so--and she's written an article about it. We review this excellent piece of writing line-by-line, as well as addressing some coin-minting antipathy from a weird Canadian columnist that Riley found. We very much hope you enjoy.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230209 - Only Britain Fails to Soldier On.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230209 - Only Britain Fails to Soldier On.mp3

item.title: Where The Boys Are feat. Mattie Lubchansky
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230207 - Where The Boys Are feat. Mattie Lubchansky.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! We brought on friend of the show and extremely good cartoonist Mattie Lubchansky (@lubchansky) to discuss their new book BOYS WEEKEND. They wanted to register a website for the book at boysweekend.com, but it’s been parked on by a group of guys who’ve been having boys’ weekends since 2000. And posting about it on a very web 1.0 site. So, cleary we had to talk about it, as well as more AI-related news, and much more. Check out the actual site for BOYS WEEKEND here, and preorder a copy: www.boysweekend.biz

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230207 - Where The Boys Are feat. Mattie Lubchansky.mp3

item.title: FBI Anime Girlfriend Chatbot feat. Paris Marx
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230203 - FBI Anime Girlfriend Chatbot feat. Paris Marx.mp3
item.description: This week, we're speaking with Paris Marx (@parismarx) of the Tech Won't Save Us podcast about recent developments in AI--the grift moving from web 3.0 to artificial intelligence, the idea that anything is good enough so long as it automates people out of a job, and much more. Hope you enjoy! Check out Tech Won't Save Us here: https://techwontsave.us

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230203 - FBI Anime Girlfriend Chatbot feat. Paris Marx.mp3

item.title: AmeriCOIN feat. Joe Weisenthal
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230131 - AmeriCOIN feat. Joe Weisenthal.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, we speak with Joe Weisenthal (@TheStalwart) of the Bloomberg dot com Odd Lots podcast about minting the coin. But not just any coin: a strange loophole in a ’90s law designed to let the U.S. Mint produce collectors’ coins basically means that, if they wanted to, the director could order the Mint to issue a platinum coin of any denomination. Two dollars. Ten million dollars. One trillion dollars. But will the Democrats use this to completely undercut Republican debt ceiling brinkmanship? Probably not? Check out Odd Lots here: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/odd-lots/id1056200096

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230131 - AmeriCOIN feat. Joe Weisenthal.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230131 - AmeriCOIN feat. Joe Weisenthal.mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230126 - No True Starmer feat. Abi Thorn.mp3
item.description: Abi Thorn (@PhilosophyTube) joins Riley, Milo, and Alice for a mostly dessert episode today! (Hussein continues to recover from a wasting disease, and will be back soon). In the mean time we’ve got news, startups, more Elon nonsense, and then to top it off we try to elucidate “Starmerism” as a political theory, rather than just a media management strategy.

item.title: Britainology 53: Blue Peter
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230120 - Britainology 53_ Blue Peter.mp3
item.description: For this month's first Britainology, Nate and Milo examine a BBC children's show that has been running since the 1950s, despite no one watching it. The show is called Blue Peter, it's extremely boring, it feels like it's been taken out of a different era, and yes, there are allegations of adultery and drug use (it's Britain after all!) Hope you enjoy.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230120 - Britainology 53_ Blue Peter.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230120 - Britainology 53_ Blue Peter.mp3

item.title: Trashfuture Avanti West Coast feat. Gareth Dennis
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230119 - Trashfuture Avanti West Coast feat. Gareth Dennis.mp3
item.description: This week’s bonus features writer and rail engineer Gareth Dennis (@GarethDennis), host of the Rail Natter YouTube show, discussing the current state of British trains. The Tories are ideologically opposed to state capacity, sure, that’s table stakes, but did you know that Labour also promise to not fix the unavoidable problems with the UK’s rail network? Shocking, we realise. Also, we discuss a mental health startup. Check out Rail Natter here! https://www.youtube.com/c/GarethDennisTV *MILO ALERT* Check out Milo’s upcoming live shows here: https://www.miloedwards.co.uk/live-shows

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230112 - The Sotadic Economic Zone feat. Ed Zitron.mp3
item.description: For this week's bonus, the nearly-full cast of Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice speak with technology publicist and crypto sceptic Ed Zitron about the current state of the cryptocurrency market--of course it's a scam, everyone knows that, but just how much is it on the precipice? The answer will probably not shock you, but might unsettle you regardless. Hope you enjoy! Check out Ed's newsletter on Substack here: https://ez.substack.com

item.title: All Emergency Services Suspended; Crime Still Illegal
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230109 - All Emergency Services Suspended; Crime Still Illegal.mp3
item.description: It’s the free one! The gang says goodbye to Matt Hancock MP, the fabulous app where we all met for the first time. Also, a real use for NFT's finally discovered. Mostly, though, we face up to a grim reality: the society of universal services that defined the postwar period has now fundamentally broken. Predictably, the worst people in the country are all scratching their heads and asking how it happened. item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230105 - Tales of the Spite Cube_ TF Live in Brisbane feat. Aidan 'Taco' Jones.mp3
item.description: For this week's bonus, here's the live show we barely remember. It was our first show of the tour in Australia, we were jet lagged to the end of the earth, Milo was out sick with tummy trouble, and we were joined with special guest and friend of the show Aidan 'Taco' Jones to discuss... a spite cube. And a niche kind of Australian vehicle theft where you tell everyone exactly what you're about to do. This show took place at Good Chat in Brisbane on November 7, 2022. Hope you enjoy!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20230103 - Savoury Vapes Rising_ Community Justice is Served (A Trashfuture New Years).mp3
item.description: It’s the free one! Riley, Milo, and Alice ring in the new year by looking at the Economist’s rosy predictions in an alternate universe where Britain magically becomes fine due to the power of positive thinking and sharp dressing. We also look at some developments in Scotland, and Labour’s plan to give every homeowner control of Trident to deal with the rampant issue of young people loitering. Finally, we round off by looking at a new Yacht Neom DLC. item.description: It's the free one! Riley, Milo, and Alice festively discuss some Christmas presents granted by the news, including the arrest of the dread pirate Bankman Fried and Elon Musk posting himself into penury. Also, Dom Leusder joins Riley in the second half to talk about the concept of “polycrisis” that appears to now be inescapable, to attempt a more firm definition of a nebulous, but useful, concept.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221220 - Oh Sovereign, My Sovereign feat. Quinn Slobodian.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week’s free episode is all about William Rees Mogg and James Dale Davidson’s book “the sovereign individual,” which describes a wonderful world in which fifty rich men live in armoured citadels and everyone else scrapes a living off the land. Do not become addicted to water, my friends! If you want to learn more about Quinn Slobodian's work, check out his site here: https://www.quinnslobodian.com

item.title: The Ballad of Landmine Steve: AI Week Part 2 feat. Callum Cant
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221215 - The Ballad of Landmine Steve_ AI Week Part 2 feat. Callum Cant.mp3
item.description: Callum Cant from Autonomy and Fairwork joins the gang for Part 2 of AI Week, where we go in depth about what the fair introduction of AI to workplaces might look like. Fairwork is starting the research process to answer this question, and we’re looking at what they intend to achieve and what the answers may be. Here’s a hint: it starts with an “O” and rhymes with an “Blorganised Labour.”

item.title: John Henry Mnemonic: AI Week Part 1 ft. James Vincent
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221213 - John Henry Mnemonic_ AI Week Part 1 ft. James Vincent.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! The Verge’s James Vincent joins Alice and Riley (and Hussein shortly thereafter) to discuss language models - specifically ChatGPT, and how it fits into OpenAI and Microsoft’s plans. We ask - what is its “fluent bullshit” good enough to disrupt in a world that increasingly relies on paying people for bullshit jobs? Buy James’s book ‘Beyond Measure’ here!

item.title: Britainology 51: Adrian Chiles feat. Adrian Chiles
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221210 - Britainology 51_ Adrian Chiles feat. Adrian Chiles.mp3
item.description: In this month's first Britainology, we interview the UK's only good columnist about his new book 'The Good Drinker: How I Learned to Love Drinking Less.' The book is available here from Profile Books. However, rest assured that we talk about the book for about half of this interview, and the other half is a masterclass on process where we learn how Adrian comes up with columns such as 'I recently saw something in a petrol station toilet southbound on the M1 that I can never unsee.' Hope you enjoy!

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221210 - Britainology 51_ Adrian Chiles feat. Adrian Chiles.mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221208 - All That Is My Apartment Melts Into Air feat. Vicky Spratt.mp3
item.description: This week, we’re speaking with Vicky Spratt (@Victoria_Spratt) of the I Paper about her new book Tenants: The People on the Frontline of Britain’s Housing Emergency. Why has Britain regressed so badly on housing conditions? Is anyone with any political power aiming to fix this? The answer will probably not surprise you. Preorder Vicky’s book here: https://profilebooks.com/work/tenants/

We review the current state of unreality in British politics, the supposed Musk war on Apple (not going well for Musk), a bit of Australian hooning reverie, and Hussein’s story about a grammar school bully making people drink water from a puddle to prove they’re not gay. It’s all coming together, folks!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221202 - National Posting Service, Part 2 (feat. Mike Isaac).mp3
item.description: This week, we're talking to Mike Isaac of the New York Times about Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter. And, let's be real, his desire to be loved, his insane right wing tendencies, the slow grinding of the platform into the ground, and the bizarre tech-libertarian freak thought undergirding all of the PayPal Mafia's conception of the world. This is part two of two!

item.title: Busting Offsets feat Dr Jess Green
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221107 - Busting Offsets feat Dr Jess Green.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, Riley, Milo, and Alice join Dr Jess Green (@greenprofgreen) to discuss the concept of carbon offsets and how they’re not the foolproof solution to climate change that every huge polluter who definitely wants to keep polluting seems to think they are! Or maybe they’re just pretending to think that! *AUSTRALIA ALERT* We’re currently in Australia, and there are tickets available for shows in Sydney: https://musicboozeco.oztix.com.au/outlet/event/3213de46-cef7-49c4-abcb-c9bdf4bcb61f and Canberra: https://au.patronbase.com/_StreetTheatre/Productions/TFLP/Performances *BRITAINOLOGY ALERT* We’ve added a live show in Melbourne on the 19th of November in which Nate and Milo will present Britainology! item.description: It's the free one! Is it a good sign for an economy when you're getting recommended installment-plan purchases for cheap takeaway foods? Is it any wonder that Nick Clegg may have gotten wrapped up in a scandal involving putting OnlyFans creators on a kind of no-fly list? Is it going to come as a shock that Britain's conservative columnists think electrical blackouts will teach spoiled young people a lesson? item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20221004 - Amazon Billing Amazon for Amazon feat. Cory Doctorow and Rebecca Giblin.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! Cory Doctorow and Rebecca Giblin come on to discuss their new book “Chokepoint Capitalism,” which details how large companies have identified critical bottlenecks in the creative Labour process to suck the value and life out of them like vampires, and what can and has been done about it. Also, a startup! U.K. economic implosion to be discussed in this week’s bonus. Buy Rebecca and Cory's book here! https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/710957/chokepoint-capitalism-by-cory-doctorow-and-rebecca-giblin/

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220920 - Fill Your Love Gap feat. Jathan Sadowski.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice join special guest and friend of the show Jathan Sadowski (@jathansadowski) of the This Machine Kills podcast (@machinekillspod) to discuss microfinance. Despite the Nobel Prizes involved, it turns out it’s just app-connected loan sharking in many ways. We also discuss a mental health app that provides crowdsourced therapy. Is it licensed? Hey, that’s just a technicality.

item.title: Tropical Blockchain Night, Part 1 of 2 feat. Ian MacDougall
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220830 - Tropical Blockchain Night, Part 1 of 2 feat. Ian MacDougall.mp3
item.description: We bring on journalist Ian MacDougall to discuss the libertarian intentional-community of Prospera, a failing city-state in the Bay Islands of Honduras, where Thiel- and Andreessen-funded weirdos have tried to create a land where anyone can open a business with any law, from any jurisdiction, anywhere, adjudicated by some guys in Arizona. We’re not making this up. Read Ian’s article here! https://restofworld.org/2021/honduran-islanders-push-back-libertarian-startup/

We also talk a bit about Tesla’s $15k DLC for your car, and a lot of riffs about homophobic truck owner memes in the United States. item.title: Water 2
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220818 - Water 2.mp3
item.description: It's the alternate chaos configuration of Hussein, Nate, and Alice discussing the UK's current drought, its privatised water infrastructure, the fact that no new capacity has been added since 1989... except for a special boy's special project in Beckton. We also read an article that claims blockchain can solve the world's water issues. We will always suffer for content.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220818 - Water 2.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220818 - Water 2.mp3

item.title: Doctors’ Advice: Drink 14 Gallons of Water Right Now (feat. Mattie Lubchansky)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220816 - Doctors’ Advice_ Drink 14 Gallons of Water Right Now (feat. Mattie Lubchansky).mp3
item.description: This week it’s Milo, Hussein, Nate, and Alice, joined by special guest Mattie Lubchansky (@lubchansky), and we’re discussing the UK’s energy pricing woes. Which are solely related to privatisation. Which everyone can see coming and nobody is going to do anything about. We also discuss an app-connected water bottle that sometimes tells you to drink enough water to kill you if its sensors are off. There’s a special smart segment in this episode in which Riley speaks with Dr Craig Berry about the disasters of privatised pensions. If you enjoy this discussion, Craig’s book is available here: https://global.oup.com/academic/product/pensions-imperilled-9780198782834?cc=gb&lang=en&

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220816 - Doctors’ Advice_ Drink 14 Gallons of Water Right Now (feat. Mattie Lubchansky).mp3

item.title: Nikolai Gogol’s Dead Digital Souls
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220809 - Nikolai Gogol’s Dead Digital Souls.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! There may be disruptions in the free-money-forever ecosystem of the tech industry, but that hasn’t stopped new ideas springing forth. For example: what if we made an AI chatbot but it had feelings? And we made it do spreadsheet-factory jobs? This is one of the propositions from a new startup we’ve uncovered called–and this is not a joke–Digital Souls. *MILO ALERT* Here are links to see Milo’s upcoming standup shows: https://www.miloedwards.co.uk/live-shows *AUSTRALIA ALERT* We are going to tour Australia in November, and there are tickets available for shows in Sydney: https://musicboozeco.oztix.com.au/outlet/event/3213de46-cef7-49c4-abcb-c9bdf4bcb61f Melbourne https://tccinc.sales.ticketsearch.com/sales/salesevent/75729 and Brisbane https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/trashfuture-live-in-brisbane-additional-show-tickets-396915263237.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220802 - Coal Mine Canary Story Hour.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, we're talking the Metaverse, we're talking FB's valuation plummeting because iOS lets you improve your digital privacy by 1%, and we're talking the recent furore with drag queen story hours and how American fascists and British transphobes have been coalescing and continue to do so. *AUSTRALIA ALERT* We are going to tour Australia in November, and there are tickets available for shows in Melbourne https://tccinc.sales.ticketsearch.com/sales/salesevent/75729 and Brisbane https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/trashfuture-live-in-brisbane-tickets-389786119777). item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220719 - Britainology 42_ Skins.mp3
item.description: Now unlocked to the $5 tier! For this month's second Britainology, Milo makes Nate watch season 1, episode 1 of the Channel 4 teen comedy/drama 'Skins.' Nicholas Hoult is in demon twink mode causing chaos all around flip-phone-era Bristol c. 2007, and Nate marvels at the fact that a show like this would have been much harder to make for network TV in the US back in those days. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: Far From The Gurning Crowd
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220705 - Far From The Gurning Crowd.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! We continue to follow the incipient strike wave in Britain now spreading to other industries, and think about how the veil between ourselves and a more livaeble, dignified existence is once again at its thinnest. We also discuss Labour’s manifest inability to rise to the moment… and then we delve into the mountains of madness with an article about how Glastonbury should be replaced with a Ukrainian army recruitment centre. If you’re looking for a UK strike fund to donate to, here’s one we’ve supported: https://www.rmt.org.uk/about/national-dispute-fund/

item.title: Britainology 40: Love Island
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220630 - Britainology 40_ Love Island.mp3
item.description: Now unlocked to the $5 tier! For this month's premium Britainology, we discuss the show Love Island. Neither of us are Love Island watchers so we're coming into this as neophytes, and we ask: what does it say about Britain? Is there something to be learned from watching it? Is there something to be learned from watching people who insist that there's a deeper meaning to it? All this and more

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220628 - The Taking of Britain 123 ft. Gareth Dennis.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! Rail Natter's Gareth Dennis joins the gang to discuss the RMT's strike action. We look at what made striking necessary, what striking does for everyone (not just the strikers!), and - of course - we run down the Mick Lynch daytime TV hit list. Gareth mentions a strike fund in the episode, which you can access here: https://www.rmt.org.uk/about/national-dispute-fund/

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220624 - Britainology 39_ The Royals feat. Dr Eleanor Janega.mp3
item.description: This month we've spoken with friend of the show and knower of medieval history Dr Eleanor Janega (@GoingMedieval) on the topic of the British monarchy. Not just the current state of affairs (although we do get into that), but also the unbroken lineage all the way back to 1066. Why is it that we've simply put up with it for so long?

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220624 - Britainology 39_ The Royals feat. Dr Eleanor Janega.mp3

item.title: A Series of Tubes ft. Ben Tarnoff
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220623 - A Series of Tubes ft. Ben Tarnoff.mp3
item.description: The gang talks to Ben Tarnoff about his book “Internet for the People,” which looks at the present miserable state of the internet “as public utility,” and how it can be made better. But first, we look at a startup back from the dead, think about the on-purpose recession that the global north is about to tip into and (thinking about other recessions), what we can expect, and how the IMF created political monsters it can no longer control. Buy Ben's book here! https://www.versobooks.com/books/3927-internet-for-the-people

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220623 - A Series of Tubes ft. Ben Tarnoff.mp3

item.title: Cryptocurrency 1929-2008 Speedrun (Framecount in Video)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220621 - Cryptocurrency 1929-2008 Speedrun (Framecount in Video).mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, Riley, Milo, Nate, and Alice react to new developments from UK politics (it’s wedge week!) and the crypto world, where discussions are taking place to encourage central banks to help unwind stablecoins. What does that mean? Well, it means free money, more scamming, and no time spent on explaining the actual use case–there isn’t one. As mentioned in the show notes, there’s a fundraiser for the 9 people arrested during a recent Stop Deportations action in Uxbridge. Please contribute here if you can! https://www.gofundme.com/f/support-stop-deportations

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220621 - Cryptocurrency 1929-2008 Speedrun (Framecount in Video).mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220621 - Cryptocurrency 1929-2008 Speedrun (Framecount in Video).mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220616 - Wirecard_ The Shaved Poodle Affair feat. Dan McCrum.mp3
item.description: This week, Riley, Milo, and Alice speak with FT reporter and author Dan McCrum (@FD) about his forthcoming book 'Money Men: A Hot Startup, a Billion Dollar Fraud, a Fight for the Truth.' It is of course about Wirecard, and it's got some amazing details that we simply lose our minds about as Dan recounts them. Hope you enjoy! Buy Dan's book here!

item.title: Nate Will Be Synonymous with Failure
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220614 - Nate Will Be Synonymous with Failure.mp3
item.description: Riley is out this week, and in his stead we’ve convened a special episode of Trashfuture featuring Milo, Hussein, Nate, and Alice on the topic of a failing ‘AI’ startup called Nate. Yes, it’s called Nate. And it’s a pure, concentrated example of ‘what if your robot was just a guy.’ We draw heavily from Malique Morris’s article from The Information, and you should read it https://www.theinformation.com/articles/shaky-tech-and-cash-burning-giveaways-ai-shopping-startup-shows-excesses-of-funding-boom and also follow him on twitter at @luxeoflique If you want access to our Patreon bonus episodes, early releases of free episodes, and powerful Discord server, sign up here: https://www.patreon.com/trashfuture *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind our website). If you need web design help, reach out to him here: https://www.tomallen.media/ Trashfuture are: Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), Nate (@inthesedeserts), and Alice (@AliceAvizandum)

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220614 - Nate Will Be Synonymous with Failure.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220614 - Nate Will Be Synonymous with Failure.mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220610 - Britainology 38_ Jeremy Vine (feat. Jeremy Vine).mp3
item.description: In this special edition of Britainology, Nate and Milo traveled to BBC2 Studios to interview the man himself, Jeremy Vine, in order to discuss how he keeps a straight face when asked to arbitrate questions such as 'should a panel of mums decide all criminal punishment in the UK' and 'is your tea kettle as loud as your lawn mower (please bring the lawn mower into your kitchen for a comparison).' Hope you enjoy!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220609 - Balthasar Speedboat Down Under feat. Plumbing the Death Star.mp3
item.description: We're back with pure riffs and no topic, and we're joined by Joel, Joel, and Jackson from the popular Australian podcast Plumbing the Death Star. We recorded this back in March and now it's out. Please enjoy us rejoicing in the class system of car park sausages in Australia, the wonder of Bob Katter pointing a gun at a knife, and a story about a little boy who wanted a pet pig.

item.title: XP Grinding at the Spreadsheet Factory
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220603 - XP Grinding at the Spreadsheet Factory.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! And it's out very early! This week, Riley, Hussein, Nate and Alice discuss the cost-of-living crisis in Britain as seen through trade periodicals for grocers and the growing sentiment among the police (yes! Even among the British police!) that shoplifting to survive shouldn’t be punished. We also discuss new developments in the endless hackathon purgatory of the crypto world, where they want to make everything you’ve ever done in your working life tied to your identity, on the blockchain.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220603 - XP Grinding at the Spreadsheet Factory.mp3

item.description: Please enjoy this live recording of Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Nate performing at Bristol Transformed early last month. We discuss a new, twee advancement in bossware, plus a deep dive into some of the most bizarre and unspeakable details of the Platinum Jubilee.

item.title: Universal Basic TSA
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220531 - Universal Basic TSA.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! The gang looks at the ossified politics of Britain, now unable to conceive of responding to a once-in-a-generation permanent energy crisis with anything more than a one-off payment and "good luck, you're gonna need it!" Then, we discuss a startup that looked at the spate of school shootings around the country and said, "it is with a heavy heart that we must profit from this."

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220531 - Universal Basic TSA.mp3

item.title: Automobile Conversation Part 2 of 2 ft. Victoria Scott
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220526 - Automobile Conversation Part 2 of 2 ft. Victoria Scott.mp3
item.description: This week, we're joined by auto journalist Victoria Scott (@mikurubaeahina) about new developments in automotive surveillance. As in: what if your car was the cops, recorded everything you ever did in the car, was accessible by the other cops via forensic devices, could be monitored without a warrant, and had no option for you to shut this off? Well, apparently that's 90% of cars made since 2008 already.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220526 - Automobile Conversation Part 2 of 2 ft. Victoria Scott.mp3

item.description: The gang discusses the inevitable crypto crash, tether, and the charlatans who sold ordinary people down the river. We also review Britain’s strategy for dealing with its many overlapping crises including mental health. Then, we speak to journalist Heidi Swart, whose work for the MIT technology review is all about how the surveillance industry is slowly rebuilding apartheid in South Africa. Read Heidi's article here: https://www.technologyreview.com/2022/04/19/1049996/south-africa-ai-surveillance-digital-apartheid

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220513 - The War on Cashmas.mp3
item.description: We speak with Brett Scott about the "cashless economy," and how - under the guise of convenience - another public utility (the money system denominated by cash) is being privatised into what are essentially digital casino chips controlled by banks and payment acquirers. item.title: School’s Out For Rapture ft. Josh Boerman
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220510 - School’s Out For Rapture ft. Josh Boerman.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! Josh Boerman from The Worst of All Possible Worlds joins the entire gang to discuss the Christian Dominionist designs on American society through the lens of the "school choice" campaign led by, among others, West Michigan's very own Betsy DeVos. We look at parallels between similar movements here, and how they link to other demands made by the same people. The Worst of All Possible Worlds (@TWOAPW) is a weekly podcast of case studies in the pop culture of a dying empire. Co-hosts Josh (@boshj) and Brian (@spocks_brian) grew up evangelical in Michigan and New Mexico, while A.J. (@thefuzzymask) grew up Catholic in California. Together, we deconstruct how narrative and artistic choices in popular media reflect or subvert the ongoing reactionary project in contemporary America and the world at large. TWOAPW official website: https://www.worstpossible.world TWOAPW on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/WorstOfAll Link to the article Josh wrote about Betsy DeVos for an an alumni literary journal: https://thepostcalvin.com/betsy-devos-wants-students-to-compete-for-academic-opportunity-and-thats-a-problem-heres-why/

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220510 - School’s Out For Rapture ft. Josh Boerman.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220510 - School’s Out For Rapture ft. Josh Boerman.mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220308 - The Lithium Rush ft. Thea Riofrancos.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! Riley, Alice, and Milo look at the ongoing descent of the UK pundit class into embodying the global death drive, and take a look at a story of a certain kind of British Guy achieving apotheosis (spending £218 of Bolton Council's money meant for excluded children at the Spar in Praia du Luz in Portugal). In between, Riley talks to academic Thea Riofrancos about why "onshoring" mining is all the rage now that the world's security and energy orders have both been thrown into disarray. Read Thea’s article on mining here (paywalled): https://foreignpolicy.com/2022/02/07/renewable-energy-transition-critical-minerals-mining-onshoring-lithium-evs-climate-justice/

item.description: It's the free one! This week, friend of the show Abigail Thorn (@PhilosophyTube) joins us to discuss the EHRC’s turn towards belligerent transphobia. Seems bad! We also discuss an app to buy your way into government? And some admittedly out-of-date reactions to the Russian invasion of Ukraine (we recorded this on the day it started). item.title: Don’t Fact-Check My Vibe feat. Brian Reed and Hamza Syed
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220222 - Don’t Fact-Check My Vibe feat. Brian Reed and Hamza Syed.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, Nate and Hussein speak with Brian Reed and Hamza Syed of the Trojan Horse Affair podcast, an investigation into a hoax letter in Birmingham in 2014 that–despite being known to be false–kicked off an intensification of surveillance and mistreatment of British Muslims. And everyone knew it was fake at the time! It is the official position of Trashfuture that you listen to the Trojan Horse Affair, which is available here: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2022/podcasts/trojan-horse-affair.html Also, this episode was recorded before the Observer decided to make up imaginary vibes-based critiques of the show (it was recorded last week).

Nate and Milo watched the early-2000s UK TV show 'Road Wars' and talked about British cops, but the episode got derailed with various tales of personal experiences with cops, and how little you can get away with in the US without getting arrested and charged. Hope you enjoy!

item.description: We speak with Q Anon Anonymous U.K. correspondent Annie Kelly about how, far from being fringe whackos, the lumpen petit bourgeois wingnuts that meet on telegram and gather outside Parliament are central to the right wing project. Also, we read Starmer’s baffling paean to NATO.

item.description: It's the free one! Gareth Dennis (@GarethDennis) of Rail Natter returns to our hallowed halls to talk about, among other things, the decision to put the capital’s transport network into “managed decline,” so we can enjoy the standards of infrastructure currently only available to exotic places like “Italy” or “Quebec.” Also, a Foxtons for the Metaverse. Check out Rail Natter here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzA-8fUrw2C5cRcP9gO5BwA

item.title: Life Sentences by Stealth: Nate Interviews Sam Asumadu about IPPs
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220214 - Life Sentences by Stealth_ Nate Interviews Sam Asumadu about IPPs.mp3
item.description: In this special extra segment, Nate interviews Sam Asumadu from Media Diversified (@WritersOfColour) about the phenomenon of Indeterminate Sentences for Public Protection (IPPs), a now-banned sentence that has resulted in thousands of British residents effectively receiving life sentences for acts as minor as stealing a mobile phone at age 17. Sam’s written an article on the topic for OpenDemocracy, which is available here: https://www.opendemocracy.net/en/opendemocracyuk/families-plea-over-barbaric-indefinite-prison-sentences-for-minor-crimes/ Check out Media Diversified’s Linktree here: https://linktr.ee/mediadiversified

What are its weaknesses? But first, we look into a number of chickens that appear to have come home to roost in the Labour Party. Riley Quinn: And also, of course, we talk about a ludicrous Web3 Project. Buy Phil’s book here! https://www.versobooks.com/books/3851-fal

item.description: This was released on the free feed as well Riley sits down for a discussion of the implications of the upcoming Health and Care Act for the NHS with Dr Allyson Pollock and Peter Roderick from Newcastle University, and tries to get to the heart of the question: what do we mean when we talk about “privatising the NHS.”

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220201 - Attack of the 100-Foot Metaverse.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! We look at the shape of the (contracting) frontiers of politics and (expanding) frontiers cooked up in the minds of our most addled billionaires. Let Mark Zuckerberg make a skinwalker out of you, let Elon Musk put your brain into a tunnel, but try to work a little less and - as the British state always does - then "we got problems."

item.description: It's the free one! Jathan and Ed from TMK return to help us figure out exactly what “Web 3” is, and what people actually mean when they say “Web 3.” What we find when we look under the hood is a virtual series of colonia dignidads all layered on top of one another promising that only when we have interpreted Hayek correctly, will we find utopia.

item.description: In which we get into the specific zones of the Millennium Dome, their various corporate sponsors, and what they said about Britain c. 2000 and how New Labour saw its subjects' lives. We completely lost our minds doing this and we hope you enjoy.

item.title: A Dome That Sucked, Part 1
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20220104 - A Dome That Sucked, Part 1.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, we have the full cast of TF together to review the history of the Millennium Dome, a New Labour attempt to create a modern exposition of Britain. It definitely became an exhibition of how weird the inner circle of Blair’s Labour was, but it’s largely regarded as a failure–and we learn about how it transformed a chunk of Greenwich from the Goop Zone into the Empty Luxury Flat Zone.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211228 - Nate and Alice’s Book Corner_ ‘The Verifiers’ feat. Jane Pek.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! For the holiday week, Nate and Alice speak to author Jane Pek about her debut novel THE VERIFIERS, a detective story involving online dating, the ever-present algorithm, the tech economy, and Alice’s long-standing dream to read about a lesbian private investigator. This was a lot of fun for us to record, and if you enjoy it, please reach out! We’re happy to try and make this an ongoing series. *NOTICE* If you enjoy this episode then you should run, not walk, to pre-order THE VERIFIERS here: https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/671896/the-verifiers-by-jane-pek/

item.description: Now unlocked to the $5 tier! We decided to review a different kind of Christmas movie: David Cronenberg's 2007 film EASTERN PROMISES, which is both a film about Britain, a film about Russians in London (featuring no Russian actors), and a film where you see Viggo Mortensen naked. We got Olga Koch (@rocknrolga) on to discuss this and, uh, she did not like it.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211221 - Into the Clegg-averse.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! Former Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg now works for Facebook to the tune of eight figures. He has some opinions about Facebook’s policy decisions. As you can guess, they sound like thoughts from a man who’s been hit in the head really hard–which is why Riley, Milo, and Alice analyze a recent Meta appearance in which his Nintendo Wii-looking avatar complains about his headset a lot, among other things. We also talk about the recent byelection in North Shropshire. Hope you enjoy!

item.description: This week, in the midst of Riley and Milo being struck with covid, we recorded an all-remote episode to discuss some recent Britain news, with a special emphasis on recent leaked texts from Daniel Kawczynski MP in which he's begging for a Saudi consultancy role in order to pay private school fees. There are a lot of other points covered in this episode but this part really captures something ineffably British. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: The Value Is Coming From Inside the House feat. Trevor Strunk
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211214 - The Value Is Coming From Inside the House feat. Trevor Strunk.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, we speak with writer and friend of the show Trevor Strunk (@hegelbon) about recent developments in the smartest sector of our very real economy: the gaming/crypto convergence, in which powerful thinkers from Andreesen Horowitz have decided that the best way to develop jobs is to pay people in the developing world a pittance to do XP grinding on behalf of gamers in the developed world. Sounds great to us! We also address the British politics moment surrounding the 2020 Christmas party and why it's superseded coverage of the UK government's new bill that lets them strip citizenship of anyone they choose. Hope you enjoy! Also: run, do not walk, to purchase Trevor’s book STORY MODE here: http://www.prometheusbooks.com/books/9781633886803 If you want access to our Patreon bonus episodes, early releases of free episodes, and powerful Discord server, sign up here: https://www.patreon.com/trashfuture If you’re in the UK and want to help Afghan refugees and internally displaced people, consider donating to Afghanaid: https://www.afghanaid.org.uk/ *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind our website). item.title: Britainology 27: We Watched a Dave Courtney Movie
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211129 - Britainology 27_ We Watched a Dave Courtney Movie.mp3
item.description: Now unlocked to the $5 tier! Look, this is something of a loose episode because Milo was on tour while we recorded it. However, in an effort to satisfy our urge to explain Britain, we watched the 2016 film GANGSTERS, GAMBLERS AND GEEZERS which is a z-grade British knockoff of Harold and Kumar, features none other than Dave Courtney, and contains some of the worst shit we've ever seen. If we can ever get our hands on the Dave Courtney-directed film GATWICK GANGSTERS, we'll watch it. However, at present, you cannot watch it anywhere--legally or highly illegally--because it has no actual distribution. Sad! Anyway, hope you enjoy.

item.description: It's the free one! Riley, Milo, and Alice are joined by our friend Séamus Malekafzali (@seamus_malek) for a Neom Status update. With the rollicking success of The Line leaving every industry the world over revolutionised forever, Saudi has added yet another dimension to the shape of innovation. But first, a reflection on the growth and role of vigilantism in the US and U.K., and a look at the dreams versus the reality of electric car producers who promise to change the world but still haven’t really made any… cars. Check out Séamus' Substack here: https://malekafzali.substack.com

item.description: This week, Nate and Milo discuss the phenomenon of remembrance poppies and the ways in which they've become a symptom of Britain's deeply unwell state. Solemn icons of the human cost of war? Hell no, slap that shit on a pizza and consume it, with honour.

item.title: The Fabulous Mechanical Turk ft. Phil Jones
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211116 - The Fabulous Mechanical Turk ft. Phil Jones.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! We speak to Phil Jones, author of Work Without the Worker, about microwork and how AI is fake, and most of it is just tiny tasks done by workers in the global south and dressed up as technology. We get deeper into how exactly how this practice developed, how its economics are rooted in overproduction, and how boosterish liberal institutions cheer-led the whole process. Get Phil's book here! https://www.versobooks.com/books/3869-work-without-the-worker

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211021 - The Great Train Robbery feat Gareth Dennis.mp3
item.description: The gang talks all things rail with with railway engineer and the host of Rail Natter, Gareth Dennis. We go back into the history of how Britain's railways "got like that," and how government plans to centralise and revitalise Great British Rail is just a coat of red white and blue paint over (you guessed it!) giving money to scammy start ups.

item.title: Concrete Island feat. Daniel Trilling
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211019 - Concrete Island feat. Daniel Trilling.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! We had journalist Daniel Trilling on the podcast to discuss his research into The Home Office - how it became such a strange, cruel, dysfunctional department, and how it fits into the larger cruel absurdities of immigration policy in western countries. Also, we talk excitedly about Matt Hancock’s new appointment to the UN (…we got the bad news a couple days after recording). If you’re in the UK and want to help Afghan refugees and internally displaced people, consider donating to Afghanaid: https://www.afghanaid.org.uk/ *MILO ALERT* Milo Edwards comperes a stellar line-up of professional acts trying new material, headlined by Archie Henderson. See it on 26 October at 19:30, Sekforde Arms, London EC1R 0HA: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-archie-henderson-tickets-188961367537 And check out more Milo live dates here: https://www.miloedwards.co.uk/live-shows *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind our website). If you need web design help, reach out to him here: https://www.tomallen.media/ Trashfuture are: Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), Nate (@inthesedeserts), and Alice (@AliceAvizandum)

item.title: Britainology 25: The North feat. Rob Smith and Kaye Wiggins
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211018 - Britainology 25_ The North feat. Rob Smith and Kaye Wiggins.mp3
item.description: This week, Nate and Milo discuss the North-South divide of England with help from two friends of the show--and FT reporters--Rob Smith (@bondhack) and Kaye Wiggins (@kayewiggins). Rob is from Derby (technically not in the North, but presumed to be) and Kaye is from Southport (definitely in the North). We discuss their experiences in the South, the fact that Liverpool and Essex have so much in common, and a guide for international students in the UK that offers a doctrinal definition of Northern Monkeys vs Southern Fairies. Hope you enjoy! Rob and Kaye worked on a piece about financial misadventures in the North that you should check out: https://t.co/YaFREWTHbg?amp=1

item.description: Elon Musk has greenwashed an oil refinery! We speak with fintwit blogger ESGHound about just how this was possible. We also looked into the ongoing issues surrounding Tether. But first, we look at the greatest achievement in British Journalism, as Iain Duncan Smith writes that Britain wouldn't have worked from home during the Blitz.

item.title: Trashfuture Presents: John Taliban, Episode 1
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20211012 - Trashfuture Presents_ John Taliban, Episode 1.mp3
item.description: Several months ago, Alice Caldwell-Kelly awoke from a literal fever dream covered in a sheen of sweat, with one name on her lips: JOHN TALIBAN. A man whose name is just, coincidentally, Taliban. A man who loves Ford cars. Maybe his name’s Hungarian, it’s impossible to know. And now, from that impossible dream, Alice and friend of the show Noah Suarez-Sikes have written a real pilot which we’ve table read for you—the loyal hog. Please enjoy this TF Special Presentation™ of JOHN TALIBAN. CAST LIST: John Taliban: @Devon_OnEarth (Devon) Erika Joiner: @AliceAvizandum (Alice Caldwell-Kelly) Ashleigh Belden: @PrhRoy (Phoebe Roy) Squib Jackson: @Milo_Edwards (Milo Edwards) Heppie Jackson: @GoingMedieval (Dr Eleanor Janega) Chent Mustang: @inthesedeserts (Nate Bethea) Carter: @notliamanders0n (Liam Anderson) Waiter / Charon: @who_shot_jgr (Justin Roczniak) Kennedy Cutout / Stage Directions: @noahpasaran (Noah Suarez-Sikes)

item.description: It's the free one! Mark Zuckerberg is building the future of the internet, and the future of everything, and it’s basically a much more exploitative version of Habbo Hotel. Where we’re going, you won’t need eyes to see… it’s the Metaverse! And thankfully we've got Jathan Sadowski, friend of the show and cohost of the This Machine Kills Podcast, to explain it further.

item.description: This week Riley, Milo, and Alice address a new startup that will--and we are not joking--allow your boss to hire call centre workers to ping you with smartphone notifications when you suffer a personal tragedy. And, of course, a lot more. We also revisit some old friends (Bill Gross, Softbank) and a plan for the Tories to send in old army men to "de-woke" the NHS.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210923 - Post-Shug Clarity.mp3
item.description: We've found another terrible startup: a billion-dollar-valuation 'plastic recycling' venture that is too dangerous to actually work (but would absolve the oil industry of any need to change its business model). It operates via a concept called shugging. It also has yet again involved a promised factory in Ohio that will never exist. Prepare to get shugged. (Editor's note: this episode has some slightly throwback sounds because Hussein and Milo's mics were, uh, suboptimal. I have done my best!) *MILO ALERT* Smoke returns for another night of new material from pro-comics featuring Edinburgh Comedy Award winner Jordan Brookes. item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210916 - Sex Minidiscs_ TF Reviews 'Strange Days' (1995).mp3
item.description: This week, Milo, Nate, and Alice watched the 1995 Kathryn Bigelow film STRANGE DAYS, in which Ray Fiennes is a lovelorn memory-salesman hawking minidiscs that let you experience other people's consciousness. It's a bizarre document from the time in which its made, it's a film with cult status in certain quarters, and it posits the notion that to get over your problems, you need Angela Bassett to kick your ass. Hope you enjoy!

item.description: It's the free one! This week, we’ve got a real doozy for you: a bad startup, some Labour kremlinology, and an examination of supply chain shortages in the UK because our government are some of the dumbest people to ever breathe air. Did you know that when your taxes go up to fund privatization and pocket-stuffing, that’s actually communism? You heard it here first. item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210909 - TF Live 1 September 2021_ Mattressfuture.mp3
item.description: We're back. Yes, we did another live show at Vauxhall Comedy Club in London, and we discussed a startup that wants to make a mattress that can do DDOS attacks. We also read a Telegraph article about the decline of the West. It's Riley, Milo, Hussein, Nate, and special guest Phoebe Roy. You'll love it!

item.title: The Brian Georgetown Massacre
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210907 - The Brian Georgetown Massacre.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, we learn the story of the Diapers dot com billionaire who wants to build a utopian city in the desert based on the principles of Georgism. Does this sound like The Line? Well, it’s been compared to it by the same credulous weirdos who love that, too. Also, a startup! If you want access to our Patreon bonus episodes, early releases of free episodes, and powerful Discord server, sign up here: https://www.patreon.com/trashfuture If you’re in the UK and want to help Afghan refugees and internally displaced people, consider donating to Afghanaid: https://www.afghanaid.org.uk/ *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind our website). If you need web design help, reach out to him here: https://www.tomallen.media/ Trashfuture are: Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), Nate (@inthesedeserts), and Alice (@AliceAvizandum)

item.description: It's the free one! Alice and Riley speak with returning guest, journalist Arron Merat (@a_merat), reflecting on twenty years of cruelty and institutional failure on the part of the British state and its bloody imperial adventure in Afghanistan. It's a lot of bad memories but it wouldn't be Britainology if we didn't dredge them up!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210817 - A MILF to End Austerity feat. Alex Yablon.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! This week, Nate, Milo, Alice, and Hussein speak with journalist Alex Yablon (@alexyablon) about a US program in 2020 where the Federal Reserve leant money to municipalities--and the possibility of cutting out market-based austerity, if we want it. We also check in on Lordstown Motors and read a deeply insane ‘philosophy’ piece about why we should welcome a meteor. We discuss unionisation drives in Hollywood, why capital concentration is making films worse, the conditions for non-star workers in the US film industry, and an app that's going to redefine your biological age. It is a good time!

You will enjoy this.

item.title: New Cumbernauld Man feat. Dan Boeckner
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210805 - New Cumbernauld Man feat. Dan Boeckner.mp3
item.description: We brought on Dan Boeckner, musician from the bands Wolf Parade and Operators, podcaster with Riley from the show Bottlemen, to discuss a 1977 spy thriller called 'Cumbernauld HIT' set in Cumbernauld, Scotland. Except it was funded by the local council to promote Cumbernauld, using the film as a promo for the New Town and all its drab concrete labyrinth glory. Here is the spirit of Labourism, a new model community where society is building a new man who, crucially, does not jack off. Watch the film here if you dare! https://youtu.be/9w1Um8fd7Jc *MILO ALERT*See Milo live in London next week -- get tickets here! https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-alex-kealy-and-radu-isac-tickets-165422331647

item.title: Britainology 20: London Finance Geezers feat. Matt Edwards
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210730 - Britainology 20_ London Finance Geezers feat. Matt Edwards.mp3
item.description: This is perhaps something of a combination of Britainology and a regular TF episode in which we've brought on Matt Edwards, Milo's (much) older brother, who worked as a foreign exchange trader in London brokerages in the 1990s. We learn about the geezer-rific work environment of a bunch of guys yelling into a phone about numbers, some of the antics they got up to, what's changed since, and--perhaps on a more serious note--Matt's personal experience with what happened in Greece post-2008, a country he's worked in extensively. We very much hope you enjoy this.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210730 - Britainology 20_ London Finance Geezers feat. Matt Edwards.mp3

Why is it of such uniformly bad quality? And why has this become pretty much the only real new construction of homes in this country? Also in this episode: another re-discovered song from Johannes Vonk and the Clogheads. Owen’s new collection Clean Living Under Difficult Circumstances: Finding a Home in the Ruins of Modernism is available from Verso Books here: https://www.versobooks.com/books/3789-clean-living-under-difficult-circumstances

item.title: Britainology 19: The City of London feat. Riley Quinn
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210717 - Britainology 19_ The City of London feat. Riley Quinn.mp3
item.description: Did you know that the City of London, the small mini-enclave that dates back to Roman times, is a separate state entity that predates the United Kingdom by hundreds of years? And that its special status makes it basically immune to disclosure rules and financial oversight? Well, sort of. Riley steps in to explain The Land of the Weird Bollards and much more.

However, we would be remiss if we didn’t also include recent British news--particularly of the horny type.

item.title: Britainology 18: Poshness (feat. Charlie Palmer)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210628 - Britainology 18_ Poshness (feat. Charlie Palmer).mp3
item.description: Okay, okay, maybe you've heard the term 'posh' or 'posho' when referring to fancy British people. You're aware that this country has a reputation for its class system. But what does it actually mean? To answer this question, we brought in TF founding cohost and knower of fancy tendencies Charlie Palmer to discuss. It's all here: getting ripped at 11 am on Dubonnet, wearing a straw hat every day at school, absurd nicknames, gibberish words for everyday items, and the profound sorrow of clinging to the cultural artefacts of feudalism.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210628 - Britainology 18_ Poshness (feat. Charlie Palmer).mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210628 - Britainology 18_ Poshness (feat. Charlie Palmer).mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210624 - Do Not Zoom My Wife feat. Jamie Powell.mp3
item.description: A lot going on here! We review the recent by-election in Amersham and Chesham, the upcoming election in Batley and Spen (both of which have yielded brain god predictions from Britain's press), review an ode to Zoom by normal shaped head haver and VC elder statesman Marc Andreesen, and speak with the FT's Jamie Powell about what appears to be yet another politically connected weird fraud company. Jamie's interview is abbreviated for time concerns, but we'll post the whole thing on here tomorrow!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210615 - My Son is Also Named A Tornado of Bonhomie feat. Josie Long.mp3
item.description: It's the free one! We speak with comedian Josie Long (@josielong) about a recent article in the Atlantic about whether or not Boris Johnson is Britain’s Trump. It’s a terrible article by a guy who knows nothing about Britain, but we wanted to get down to the individual details of why it’s just so infuriating. So, enjoy this episode where we’re in a good mental space. We also talk about a startup that, despite its name, has nothing to do with coffee. Please consider donating to charities helping Palestinian people here: https://www.islamic-relief.org.uk/palestine-emergency-appeal/?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI3oja5NbR8AIVSOmyCh2LdQ9rEAAYAiAAEgKM9PD_BwE and here: https://www.grassrootsalquds.net/

item.title: Chernenko's America feat. Alex Scaggs
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210610 - Chernenko's America feat. Alex Scaggs.mp3
item.description: Financial journalist Alex Scaggs returns to talk about why the American treat based economy has strained around the edges. In short - as a result of decades of a sclerotic and implacable elite unable to get beyond their ideological commitments to shareholders, the US and UK are experiencing sky high prices, shortages of crucial goods, catastrophic misallocation of resources. But first, we talk about a "Synthetic Biology" company that's got some fun ideas about The New Flesh.

This week we have a packed studio featuring Riley, Milo, Hussein, Alice, and friend of the show Juliet Jacques (@zinovievletter) to discuss her new book Variations. We brought on Kent's finest podcaster and our cohost Hussein Kesvani to discuss it, and to prepare for it we watched a horrific Channel 4 documentary from 2013 called 'Dogging Tales.' It's a whole hell of a lot!

item.title: Britainology 15: The Cambridge Spies
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210514 - Britainology 15_ The Cambridge Spies.mp3
item.description: During World War II and the early Cold War there were a group of English intelligence operatives who spied for the Soviet Union. All of them basically walked around with huge neon signs attached to them that said 'I am a spy for the Soviet Union,' but due to the diamond-hard class solidarity of Britain's establishment, everyone forced themselves to not notice this. We brought on Alice to discuss the Cambridge Spies and we hope you enjoy it.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210511 - Where We're Shopping, We Won't Need Eyes To See feat. This Machine Kills.mp3
item.description: (This is 'The Free One', posted early for our beloved patrons) Ed and Jathan from This Machine Kills (@machinekillspod) are back to discuss another titan of the tech industry. Amazon's annual leader to shareholders has been released, and in it they advance a sort of inverse labour theory of value (who can be surprised!), with hilarious results. It's scale is now approaching a level that is hard to comprehend, so come with us across the event horizon. But first, we discuss Labour's performance in the elections and the leadership's steadfast ability to not learn anything. *MILO ALERT* Check out Milo’s live stand-up show (to be streamed over Zoom!) on May 30th here: gignify.co/miloedwardspindos

item.title: Remember When The Bin Man Was Hard?
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210511 - Remember When The Bin Man Was Hard_.mp3
item.description: Labour MP Jon Cruddas has written the best approximation of what can be considered “Starmerism’s offer to British workers.” While some elements - eg a job guarantee - are better than nothing (but even then, run their own risk of rebuilding a modern workhouse depending on the shape of the policy), even at best, their desirability and strategy for achieving them are based on a vision of the economy that nobody under 70 would recognise as realistic. So come on an annoying journey through Blue Labour nostalgia for proper jobs, when the bin men were hard. *MILO ALERT* Check out Milo’s live stand-up show (to be streamed over Zoom!) on May 30th here: gignify.co/miloedwardspindos

item.title: May 6th: The Cops Election
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210504 - May 6th_ The Cops Election.mp3
item.description: May 6th will mark regional local elections in the UK, to include the London mayoral election. Considering that 4 of the 5 of us are based in London, this does in fact affect us. However, all polling indicates that Sadiq Khan will win again on a platform of More Cops and handing all decisions to property developers, with the remaining candidates all basically wanting More Cops. Sian Berry? Bad. Laurence Fox? Don't make me laugh. Shaun Bailey? Joke. Brian Rose? Okay, he's extremely bad also, but that man is a verifiable content machine. So, we decided on a platform of 'vote if you want to do but don't really expect much either way' and then decided to talk about Brian Rose's completely bonkers life force. Hope you enjoy! If you want access to our Patreon bonus episodes, early releases of free episodes, and powerful Discord server, sign up here: https://www.patreon.com/trashfuture We support the London Renters Union, which helps people defeat their slumlords and avoid eviction. item.title: American Psychosis | Episode 2: What's Going On (Feat. Dan Boeckner)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210427 - American Psychosis _ Episode 2_ What's Going On (Feat. Dan Boeckner).mp3
item.description: Andrew and Riley are joined by Dan Boeckner of Operators and The Bottlemen for the second episode of our series about the lasting cultural impact of September 11. We discuss Dan's recollection of the day, the impact that 9/11 had on the playlists of radio stations across the country, artists censoring their own songs, misguided musical output, and the only musician we can think of to create a lasting, prescient response in the form of a memorable concept album.

item.title: Midwestology 1: A Posse, If You Will, of Insane Clowns
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210421 - Midwestology 1_ A Posse, If You Will, of Insane Clowns.mp3
item.description: We've been very happy that you, the fans, have enjoyed Britainology so much. In an attempt to bridge the gap between our two cultures, Nate has brought on two fellow Midwesterners (Francis Horton from Hell of a Way, a native of St. Louis, Missouri; Joe Kassabian from Lions Led by Donkeys, a native of Detroit, Michigan) to flip the script on Milo. Now it's the good-natured Midwestern oafs in the driver's seat, and we explain the name of the region itself, why ICP had such appeal to our generation, and why literally everyone has a driving-while-intoxicated story involving being thrown out of someone's house.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210421 - Midwestology 1_ A Posse, If You Will, of Insane Clowns.mp3

item.title: Waiting for Lordstown feat. Bryan Quinby
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210413 - Waiting for Lordstown feat. Bryan Quinby.mp3
item.description: “We’re bringing the jobs back!” has long been the rallying cry of the right, but what kinds of businesses are actually coming back to places like Lordstown, Ohio? We are joined by Bryan Quinby (@murderxbryan) of Street Fight Radio to do a deep dive on Lordstown Motors - a “too good to be true” electric car manufacturer that has set up shop in the town of the same name. It’s all well and good when rich people take money off one another, but what about the workers who believe their lives are getting back on track? The primary source for this episode was this report published by short seller Hindenburg Research, which also similarly exposed Nikola. https://hindenburgresearch.com/lordstown/

item.description: (This is this week's free episode -- we've listened to your requests and are now hosting the free episodes on here as well) This week, we’re joined by Sam Knight of the District Sentinel (@TheDCSentinel) to discuss a U.S. Supreme Court case that may make it even harder for union organizers to meet with farm labourers in the US. With the exceptionally rational and normal composition of the Court, chances are good that this could make things even worse. We also discuss Prince Harry becoming the chief engagement officer at a mental health startup in the US, because why wouldn’t he. If you want to support them as well, you can here: https://londonrentersunion.org/donate Here's a central location to donate to bail funds across the US to help people held under America's utterly inhumane system: https://bailproject.org/?form=donate *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind our website). If you need web design help, reach out to him here: https://www.tomallen.media/ Trashfuture are: Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), Nate (@inthesedeserts), and Alice (@AliceAvizandum)

item.description: Why is it that this island in the North Atlantic has such shit buildings? What is the reason for slapping gravel on buildings and calling it an aesthetic? Why did Britain sell off most of it social housing and make it functionally impossible to replace it? All this, and more, explored on yet another Britainology -- this one featuring architecture critic India Block (@indiablock)

item.title: Britainology 10: Princess Diana (RIP)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20210225 - Britainology 10_ Princess Diana (RIP).mp3
item.description: It's time once again for Britainology, and this week Milo and Nate are joined by Phoebe Roy (who you have have heard on Masters of Our Domain and 10,000 Posts) to discuss British 9/11. Do we mean 7/7? The 2011 riots? No, we mean the death of the Queen of Our Hearts, Princess Diana Spencer, in August 1997. Never has a nation freaked out more, and we provide the key to understanding it all.

item.description: There's this mysterious land called Terra Australis where the government has taken a slightly different approach to the US and UK, and as a result they have relatively normal life right now. It's the height of summer and they're enjoying their lives, and we managed to get friends of the show Tom Walker and Aidan 'Taco' Jones to discuss a variety of things with us. item.description: This is it. The last straw. The final bone. Andrew and Riley are here one last time for the final episode of season 5 of Bones. No other season of the show exists as far as we know. Join us as the writers of Bones basically give up one last time and send Bones to Indonesia, send Booth to Afghanistan and send Angela and Hodgins to fuck in ZZ Top's car. Thank you for joining us on this strange and perplexing journey into mid 2000s post-9/11 network television.

You will be able to learn all of this and more by listening.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20201123 - Tom Watson's House of Pain feat. Nish Kumar.mp3
item.description: How to explain this? Tom Watson--yes, THAT Tom Watson--has written a 'taut, political thriller' about what if Labour and the Tories came together to make sure NHS patient data was sold to pharmaceutical companies in an ethical way. It's deeply boring in a manner that reflects its author, but it's also something else: an experience. Riley read the whole book and forced Nish Kumar to listen to it along with Milo, Hussein, and Alice. Hope you enjoy!

item.description: We're at it again. Nate and Milo have reviewed the 1968 film CARRY ON UP THE KHYBER for yet another Britainology, and this one is a real laser-focused look at this absurd island. Why is it so horny? Why is everything a double entendre? Is this really the nation that once ruled the waves? You be the judge -- hope you enjoy!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20201112 - Red Jawn feat. Well There's Your Problem.mp3
item.description: Quaid... start the podcast and save Mars... Justin, Liam, and our very own Alice of Well There’s Your Problem Podcast (on Youtube!) are here to discuss Elon Musk's ludicrous plan to put humanity on spaceships with pizza restaurants in them and ship them off to Mars to live in large greenhouses for reasons of... well... Mars. Where else in the solar system are you going to live? Anyway, like most big stupid tech things - it's a fun story to distract you while SpaceX becomes a (sigh) privatiser of public goods through government contracting. Plus ca change.

item.title: Britainology 5: The Cult of the Legend
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20201018 - Britainology 5_ The Cult of the Legend.mp3
item.description: We brought on Riley to discuss a phenomenon as eternally British as bad weather itself: the legend. Who are British legends? What makes them act this way? How do you create a taxonomy of figures to distinguish between the Essex Geezer, the Entrepreneurial Legend, the High Street Hard Man, and Tim Westwood? Well, we gave it our best go.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20201018 - Britainology 5_ The Cult of the Legend.mp3

item.description: We did it again. We found an extremely criminal "tech" company -- this time, a notional Tesla competitor that makes trucks. One catch: they don't work! However, to involve the incredible financial chicanery that went into it, we brought on friend of the show Quantian1 (@quantian1) to discuss it with Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice.

item.title: Getting Dilb-pilled (feat. Aisling McCrea)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20201008 - Getting Dilb-pilled (feat. Aisling McCrea).mp3
item.description: This week, we're talking Dilbert and Scott Adams. Why? Well, for some reason all five of us liked Dilbert as a kid. Also, it just so happens that friend of the show Aisling McCrea (@ambientGillian) just published an article in Current Affairs about Dilbert's strange appeal. So, let's talk about it. Let's talk about Scott Adams' promise that he can make you no-touch cum. Let's dilb out. Read Aisling's article here! https://www.currentaffairs.org/2020/10/the-adams-principle/

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20201008 - Getting Dilb-pilled (feat. Aisling McCrea).mp3

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200924 - Gross Family Values feat. Tom Walker.mp3
item.description: Aw crikey! Australian comedian and Twitch streamer Tom Walker (@tomwalkerisgood) joins the gang to learn all about Gross Family Values. Specifically, how if you’re Bill Gross, one of the world’s most famous bond investors, you’ll react to your acrimonious divorce in 2015 by writing a series of stranger and stranger investment outlooks that focus mainly on how much you hate your imbecilic do-nothing son.

item.title: Pret Police On My Back
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200910 - Pret Police On My Back.mp3
item.description: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is a country run by and for landlords. However, the coronavirus crisis has created a problem: if people congregate en masse in offices and places of business, the disease spreads and people die! However, mitigating this requires people to not be in offices or grim city centre restaurants. So, what is the British commentator class saying about it? Die for Pret. That's right folks, you need to die for Pret.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200910 - Pret Police On My Back.mp3

item.title: In Search of (Even More) Racist Facebook
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200903 - In Search of (Even More) Racist Facebook.mp3
item.description: Have you heard the story about right-wingers who decide to build their own social media, crowdfunding, or even ridesharing sites? We're talking Gab, Hatreon, and the like. Why do they all fail? Why are they so poorly assembled? And why does this keep happening? The True Chaos Configuration of Riley, Milo, and Alice attempt to decipher this riddle for our times.

item.title: Johannes Vonk and the Clogheads Present: Honkbal Hoofdklasse (On My Radio Tonight)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200828 - Johannes Vonk and the Clogheads Present_ Honkbal Hoofdklasse (On My Radio Tonight).mp3
item.description: Here it is: the song you have all requested. The sound of the summer. The perfect musical accompaniment for standing on the honk. [breaking out of irony mode for a second] I can't express in words how much I appreciate the positive reception that this has gotten. Milo and I put in some absurdly long hours working on this, mostly because--like anyone else on planet earth who isn't a piece of garbage--we haven't exactly had a great time these past few months and it's been nice to find some sort of an outlet for it. Thank you all so much. -Nate

item.description: This week we've got Juliet Jacques (@zinovievletter) on to discuss the most cursed relationship in liberal Britain: awful right-wing lib Labour MP Rosie Duffield and her ex-boyfriend, the inscrutable Guardian columnist Adrian Chiles. It's one for the ages, a star-crossed romance, and since this is Britain you can rest assured that transphobia is involved. Hope you enjoy it!

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200812 - The Boney Island Whitefish in_ The Last Blockbuster On The Left (Feat. Will Menaker).mp3
item.description: Chest passes! Carefully aimed jump shots! Ball control without hot-dogging! That's right, Chapo Trap House's Will Menaker joins Andrew and Riley for an all-showrunner display of podcasting fundamentals. This week the brave technicians at the Jeffersonian-Medico Institute for Sexual Harassment are forced to investigate the cause of death of a very mysterious and influential historical figure! Deep respect for the boots of the American empire is sure to follow. We also spring a gotcha Breakfast Update on Will and plan our future endeavours running a Airbnb Blockbuster so that we can lecture teens about Michael Mann films. Enjoy!

item.title: Keanu Reeves Predicted 5G Corona
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200807 - Keanu Reeves Predicted 5G Corona.mp3
item.description: This week, we're in the Super Chaos Configuration: Riley is gone but you have the rest of the cast. Milo, Hussein, Nate, and Alice review the 1995 Robert Longo film JOHNNY MNEMONIC, an adaptation of a William Gibson story that, uh, did not achieve its goals. And yet it's also weirdly accurate in some ways: posting destroys your brain, there's a global pandemic, corporations rule with an iron fist. And yet somehow we haven't yet encountered a cybernetic hacker junkie dolphin. If only. We make reference to the Fetischpro video from YouTube, which you can see here -- it is definitely not work safe: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FbgJck9kUGc Here's a central location to donate to bail funds across the US to help people held under America's utterly inhumane system: https://secure.givelively.org/donate/the-bail-project If you want one of our *fine* new shirts, designed by Matt Lubchansky, then e-mail trashfuturepodcast [at] gmail [dot] com. £15 for patrons, £20 for non-patrons, plus shipping. *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind GYDS dot com). item.description: Sorry for the delayed release on this. During the recording we were convinced that we'd lost the entire Josie segment, so we recorded a second half that's almost the same length. As such, this is a long one, but I think you'll enjoy. It involves the elitism of the art world, Josie Long's commentary on the way in which the entire world is gatekept by the rich, and the second segment features a guy calling his billionaire friend for advice about the state of the world. The advice, as you might expect, is normal as hell. item.title: Britainology Episode 1: A Clump from Dave Courtney
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200710 - Britainology Episode 1_ A Clump from Dave Courtney.mp3
item.description: Welcome to the inaugural episode of Britainology, in which Milo makes Nate watch something terminally British and then explains it. This week, we're watching a documentary about self-described celebrity gangster Dave Courtney, a crime doorman who thinks he runs Britain. If you want to watch the original documentary, it's available here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wqARxpCpZU4 Our theme song for this series is from the 'Visit to Primrose Hill Extended Version' of the 1993 Blur song 'For Tomorrow,' which Nate picked because it was formative in teaching him various aspects of London geography and it's premium old millennial / young gen xer nostalgia bait. You can listen to it on Spotify here: https://open.spotify.com/track/3mvdN3a4p4SaOnpUBGWan2?si=B8IQ7g1PSfGqFw_P1dSY9Q

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200710 - Britainology Episode 1_ A Clump from Dave Courtney.mp3

item.title: The TF Union Presents: The St. Brendan's Day Debate
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200625 - The TF Union Presents_ The St. Brendan's Day Debate.mp3
item.description: It's O'Neill versus O'Neill... versus O'Neill versus O'Neill versus O'Neill versus O'Neill. It's a six-way Brendan O'Neill battle moderated by the only man who could possibly moderate a clash of intellectual titans like this: Brendan O'Neill. It may sound like @inthesedeserts, @raaleh, @Hkesvani, @AliceAvizandum, @milo_edwards, @rocknrolga, and our friend Phoebe Roy (@10kpostspod), but we must insist it is all Brendan O'Neill. They are debating the motion: THB the chattering classes of this once great nation are at it again.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200625 - The TF Union Presents_ The St. Brendan's Day Debate.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200625 - The TF Union Presents_ The St. Brendan's Day Debate.mp3

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The Suspiciously Scarce Super Soldiers
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200622 - The Boney Island Whitefish in_ The Suspiciously Scarce Super Soldiers.mp3
item.description: Riley and Andrew have swum gently upstream to once again bring you an episode of the Boney Island Whitefish. What if this murder victim was a DARPA-created hybrid human-avian killing machine? They almost definitely aren't, but imagine if they were! These are the important things that the writers of this episode of Bones want you to very briefly consider, before forgetting about that plotline. Will Angela break her volcel commitment? Does workplace exposure to sulphites change the shape of your skull? Will the murderer have a motive that isn't revealed in the last 2 minutes of the show? Find out the answers in this week's Boney Island Whitefish!

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200622 - The Boney Island Whitefish in_ The Suspiciously Scarce Super Soldiers.mp3

item.guid: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200622 - The Boney Island Whitefish in_ The Suspiciously Scarce Super Soldiers.mp3

item.description: This week's (belated, sorry!) bonus is a Balthasar Speedboat comedy special featuring Riley, Milo, Olga, and Pierre Novellie. Enjoy a discussion of the wide varieties of being horny online, how Riley spends his Christmas in Britain, and why a famous holiday songwriter also releases nude calendars for elderly women. It's a forensic examination of horniness. Hope you enjoy!
