item.description: In the logical follow-up to our previous episode about 'smart cities,' we've brought on author and researcher Jathan Sadowski (@jathansadowski) to discuss what happened with Google's plan for self-adjusting sidewalks and cities with sideways elevators. You'll love it! If you want to read more from Jathan, check out his book 'TOO SMART: How Digital Capitalism is Extracting Data, Controlling Our Lives, and Taking Over the World' from MIT Press here: https://mitpress.mit.edu/books/too-smart

item.title: Norf FC (Ultra Section) feat. Robyn Vinter
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200521 - Norf FC (Ultra Section) feat. Robyn Vinter.mp3
item.description:
We talked to Robyn Vinter of the Overtake about Culture War - what actually is it, what purpose does it serve, and why won't it end? The answer is "spite," but how we get there is more interesting. We also read an article by one of our favourite journalists on why his mission to Own The Libs may result in him losing a foot to diabetes, which is kind of like WWII when you think about it. If you want one of our *fine* new shirts, designed by Matt Lubchansky, then e-mail trashfuturepodcast [at] gmail [dot] com. £15 for patrons, £20 for non-patrons, plus shipping.

item.title: Frankenstein's Balance Sheet
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200514 - Frankenstein's Balance Sheet.mp3
item.description: There's a ticking time bomb in the economy. No, a DIFFERENT ticking time bomb. This week, Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice discuss the balance-sheet chicanery of a mysterious Australian plane enthusiast that is slowly but surely imploding every SoftBank investment vehicle. We would normally say it's a laugh riot, but this one... maybe not so much.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Cult Murder on the Secret Stealth Submarine
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200507 - The Boney Island Whitefish in_ Cult Murder on the Secret Stealth Submarine.mp3
item.description: Hey! This patron-exclusive Boonta Vista/Trashfuture collaboration is the first episode of an extremely specific podcast-within-a-podcast in which Andrew and Riley recap episodes of season 5 of the American crime procedural comedy-drama Bones. In this episode we explain the origins of Bones, why season 5 of Bones is worth examination, and the season premiere which includes Psychic Cyndi Lauper, Poopie Suits, brain surgery-induced coma hallucinations, underwater cults, fake diseases, clowns and much more.

item.title: Microsoft Rocks feat. Rob Larson
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200507 - Microsoft Rocks feat. Rob Larson.mp3
item.description:
This week we're talking tech monopolies and the ways in which Gates and Bezos used public research to become this century's dumber Carnegie and Vanderbilt. Listen to Riley, Milo, and Alice discuss it with Rob Larson (@IronicProfessor), and rejoice in the knowledge that everything you've ever done with a PC was planned out by dudes in rocking chairs for some reason. Check out Rob's Book Capitalism vs. Freedom: the Toll Road to Serfdom, out from Zer0 Books. Get it here: https://www.johnhuntpublishing.com/zer0-books/our-books/capitalism-freedom If you want one of our *fine* new shirts, designed by Matt Lubchansky, then e-mail trashfuturepodcast [at] gmail [dot] com. £15 for patrons, £20 for non-patrons, plus shipping.
*WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind GYDS dot com). If you need web design help, reach out to him here: https://www.tomallen.media/

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200430 - Intelligence 4.0 (ft. Felix Biederman).mp3
item.description: Riley, Alice, Milo, and Chapo Trap House's Felix Biederman have once again sat down and cracked open a book of brain literature. This time we read through British brain god Dr. Matt Ridley's The Rational Optimist (2010), and it left us all a lot happier as we explored a truly beautiful mind. It's a balm for the soul. Check it out!

item.title: Riley's Commie Night Club (ft. Nathalie Olah, Jesse Bernard, and Tom Usher)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200427 - Riley's Commie Night Club (ft. Nathalie Olah, Jesse Bernard, and Tom Usher).mp3
item.description: Riley's Commie Book Club is (sort of) back... but a little different. Instead of talking about a book, Riley is joined by some old friends and new to talk about nightlife - what is nightlife, why is it important, and what are the economic and social factors that threaten the continued existence of "nightlife" as something valuable? Or maybe the four of us are on the wrong end of 25 and assuming it's all bad now. Also, this was recorded before the end of the world - so many of the pressures facing nightlife have uhhh changed, but they aren't going anywhere! Anyway, maybe this is hauntology now. We'll be doing a normal "Riley reads a book episode" again soon, though!

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200427 - Riley's Commie Night Club (ft. Nathalie Olah, Jesse Bernard, and Tom Usher).mp3

item.description: We did it again. Joined once more by Séamus Malekafzali (@seamus_malek), we reviewed a terrible Hollywood take on America's imperial reach. Another CIA movie. Another movie about empire, except this time it's about a horny congressman who manages to give Al Qaeda a billion dollars. Yep, it's the 2007 Tom Hanks romp CHARLIE WILSON'S WAR, written by Aaron fucking Sorkin. Please enjoy. item.title: A Spectre Haunting Bishop Auckland (TF Live in Bristol 6.3.20 feat. Angie Speaks)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200319 - A Spectre Haunting Bishop Auckland (TF Live in Bristol 6.3.20 feat. Angie Speaks).mp3
item.description: Please enjoy this live episode of Trashfuture, recorded on March 6 the 2020 Bristol Transformed festival. You’ll hear Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), and Nate (@inthesedeserts) join special guest Angie Speaks (@speaksangie) to discuss an app that retroactively places products in existing films -- who hasn’t wanted to get ads for Casper Mattresses when watching 1970s noir films -- and a long story about a man who wants to remake Bishop Auckland in his own, uh, slightly vampiric image.

item.title: Indiana uber Alles feat. Matt Lubchansky
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20200213 - Indiana uber Alles feat. Matt Lubchansky.mp3
item.description: Did you hear about the app that wants to 3D model your face to make sure you're a girl? It's called Giggle and we do not approve of it. In this episode Riley, Hussein, Alice, and artist Matt Lubchansky (@lubchansky) also discuss Mayor Pete, the US democratic primary, and much more. We thought about calling this episode 'ISIS for Girls' but Alice got to choose the title after she completely evaporated Riley's brain by reading test copy from Pete Buttigieg's website. Don't worry -- we recorded it all. If you want to support Matt's cartooning, sign up at The Nib and receive the incredible content that they produce! Get that here: https://membership.thenib.com

item.description: It's the (belated) January edition of Riley's Commie Book Club! Riley spoke with author, academic, and labour activist Callum Cant on his book Riding for Deliveroo: Resistance in the New Economy. We get into algorithmic management, the insipid patronising internal PR of tech companies, what it's really like to ride for Deliveroo, and the new forms of solidarity emerging from precarious work. Buy Callum's book! Here's a link: https://housmans.com/product/riding-for-deliveroo/ *WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind GYDS.com). If you need web design help, reach out to him here: https://www.tomallen.media/ *COME SEE MILO*If you want to catch Milo’s stand-up on tour, get tickets here: https://linktr.ee/miloontour *LAST TICKETS ALERT* As this is posted, there are only *six tickers remaining* for our live show debate on the topic of Elon Musk's status as 21st century Willy Wonka. It's 6th Feb 7.30pm at Hen & Chickens Theatre (109 St Paul’s Road, London N1 2NA) -- tickets are £12.25 and you can get them here: https://www.unrestrictedview.co.uk/trashfuture-live-the-comedy-debate/ If you can't make it in, then tune in online, at twitch.tv/trashfuturepodcast 9 Likes

item.title: Takfir and Loathing: TF Reviews 'Body of Lies' (2008)
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20191221 - Takfir and Loathing_ TF Reviews 'Body of Lies' (2008).mp3
item.description: Look, maybe we just needed a break. Maybe there's nothing particularly good to talk about politically in this moment of elected dictatorship. However, we can talk about trash culture and the cult of super-smart drones, and as such we've reviewed the 2008 Ridley Scott film 'Body of Lies,' which is bad. Why does Leo DiCaprio dress like a podcaster? Why are there basically zero Arab actors in major roles in this film? Why is Russell Crowe such a weird Foghorn Leghorn ass guy? Listen to hear our takes on this, and much more.

item.title: Now You're Cooking with Vibes feat. Nathalie Olah
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20191107 - Now You're Cooking with Vibes feat. Nathalie Olah.mp3
item.description: You wake up. You turn on your computer to do Fiverr jobs until breakfast. You go to your job. Your contract is secure for another two weeks. You buy lunch for a tenner because you can't go on. You come home, exhausted. It's time for your next job. And you have to pay seven kinds of bills. You've become a burned out husk of a person. But now there's an exciting new venture capital backed startup called Pattern that wants to change all that with luxury cookware somehow. Riley, Milo, Alice, and special guest Nathalie Olah go deep on this strange new theory of change, and why maybe more start ups aren't the answer? Register to vote! https://www.gov.uk/register-to-vote Get campaigning! https://www.mycampaignmap.com/ We cannot stress enough how much this matters.

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club: 'Designing Freedom'
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20191027 - Riley's Commie Book Club_ 'Designing Freedom'.mp3
item.description: It's that time again! Riley's Commie Book Club is back a brief hiatus. This month, we're discussing Stafford Beer's lecture series "Designing Freedom." Beer, one of the principal architects of Cybersyn, the information network that served as the nerve centre for Allende's Chile, spent his life thinking of ways that people could organise to solve common problems in ways that do not create pointless hierarchies between them. Check it out! I reference an episode of the podcast 99% Invisible here, and I promise I would link it. So! That episode: here.

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190801 - Riley's Commie Book Club - Blindsight.mp3
item.description: It's Commie Book Club's new home! This month, Riley changes gears a little bit from the theoretical to discuss one of his favourite works of Science Fiction, Blindsight by Peter Watts. It's a hard-sci fi first contact novel that is so hard it has citations. Only very minor spoilers contained herein - you are encouraged to read it! Find it on Watts' website, where he posted it free on his website after a dispute with his publisher. Different format options available at the top https://rifters.com/real/Blindsight.htm

item.title: A Fulfilment Driven Life feat. Juliet Jacques
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190801 - A Fulfilment Driven Life feat. Juliet Jacques.mp3
item.description: You wanted to hear more Quillette close-reads, so here it is. We discuss the most bootlicking of all pro-Amazon pieces to ever appear, plus a bizarre 2006 op-ed about shoes from Rafael Behr. Our special guest Juliet Jacques (@zinovievletter) helps us break down just how brain-melt it all is. item.description: Did you know that Riley's hometown newspaper is run by horse people? Did you know that there's a Code Pink-style group that stalks people who work at the Seattle Zoo's elephant enclosure? item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190711 - The ID Card of Dorian Gray.mp3
item.description: Tony Blair, what a guy! Am I right, folks? He can't stop whining about how we need fewer houses and more apps. He can't stop pointing a finger at the Labour party and saying that it was better when we were pro-privatisation and pro-bombing. And now, of course, his institute has a great plan -- a policy paper full of nothing but management consultant speak -- with one sole defined policy goal: national ID cards. Yes, he still wants them. Enjoy this dang podcast! *LIVE SHOW ALERT* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - Imagined Communities
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190627 - Riley's Commie Book Club - Imagined Communities.mp3
item.description: It’s that time again! This month Riley is reading Benedict Anderson’s graduate seminar standby Imagined Communities. The “nation” is a concept much beloved of reactionaries and dismissed by Marxists as mere ideology. But it has serious psychological power nevertheless. Anderson’s book asks what is a “nation,” where did it come from, and how has the concept been used and misused over time? Riley then applies Anderson’s rubric to understanding the swell of white nationalism that has erupted in the West since the end of the Cold War. *WATCH THIS SPACE* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. If you’re in the West Midlands, come down to Brum for a night of delightful soup jokes. *LIVE SHOW ALERT* Come see Trashfuture live at the Edinburgh Fringe! We’ll perform on August 10th at 21.30. The venue is Venue 277, PQA Venues @Riddle's Court, Edinburgh EH1 2PG. Tickets are £11.50 and there are a ton of discounts available. item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - Marxism and the Philosophy of Science: A Critical History
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190516 - Riley's Commie Book Club - Marxism and the Philosophy of Science_ A Critical History.mp3
item.description: Another instalment of Riley's Commie Book Club delivered to you, our delightful and beloved patrons. This month, Riley decided to take it in a bit of a different direction, and talk about an under-discussed field of study, Marxism and the Philosophy of Science. How should we think about knowledge, what is knowable, and how these questions are related to history and power? To get to these questions, he reads from Helena Sheehan's Marxism and the Philosophy of Science: A Critical History. The focus of the book is on charting Marxist approaches to the philosophy of science from Engels to the mid 20th century, and while this is interesting, Riley focuses more on the underlying concepts. He absolutely encourages you to look into the book and the actual history it tells, though! It's linked here: https://www.versobooks.com/books/2565-marxism-and-the-philosophy-of-science Also, check out our live show in London on May 30th: https://www.tickettext.co.uk/trashfuture-podcast/trashfuture-live-30052019/

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190516 - Riley's Commie Book Club - Marxism and the Philosophy of Science_ A Critical History.mp3

item.title: President Jake Paul's Heated Moments feat. Chris Stokel-Walker
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190509 - President Jake Paul's Heated Moments feat. Chris Stokel-Walker.mp3
item.description: Everyone knows YouTube: the place where you can watch Peppa Pig get beheaded, watch crocodiles turn into chickens, learn about why earth is flat, and so much more. However, YouTube as a cultural phenomenon has created an entire new generation of public figures — a bunch of damn celebrities — and this week Hussein, Milo, and Nate speak with author Chris Stokel-Walker (@stokel) about his new book "YouTubers: How YouTube shook up TV and created a new generation of stars." You can buy the book here: https://www.canburypress.com/store/p28/-YouTubers-book-by-Chris-Stokel-Walker.html Also, this episode features a preview of a crossover feature on Nate's podcast What a Hell of a Way to Die: Riley and Nate discuss Warhammer 40k and why it has such cachet among weird internet reactionaries. Get it on SoundCloud here: https://soundcloud.com/hellofawaytodie/demon-guitar-solo-trumpism-feat-riley-quinn

item.description: It was a special kind of Sunday morning in London, and the whole gang gathered to record yet another episode of our comedy special Balthasar Speedboat. This round features Riley, Milo, Nate, Olga, Alex Kealy, and Pierre Novellie--and covers important topics like: what if the Hubble telescope saw God's pussy? What happens when the bullied becomes the bully? What is a samovar? And why is it that kids always find something to rip on you about? Hope you enjoy.

item.title: TF Live at Bristol Transformed feat. Jack Frayne-Reid and Dalia Gebrial
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190411 - TF Live at Bristol Transformed feat. Jack Frayne-Reid and Dalia Gebrial.mp3
item.description: This is it, folks. The first live recording with our mobile space station, the first outside-London show, and the first leftist UK politics supergroup podcast featuring Dalia Gebrial of Novara Media and Jack Frayne-Reid of Reel Politik Podcast. Recorded live at Hamilton House, Stokes Croft, Bristol on April 5, 2019, it's a show about the things that matter: brain scanning helmets that write musical symphonies, Bristol's slave-trade past, its devotion to one particular slave-trading city father, and the local Illuminati that worship him like a god.

But why is it so oblivious to the horrors of true nerd culture? Because as special guest Eleanor Penny (@eleanorkpenny) points out, there's already an insanely misogynist show lurking under its adorkable exterior. In addition, we also discuss Suella Braverman MP's recent use of the term 'Cultural Marxism,' and its origins in Nazi ideology. item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190328 - Titania McGrath Tells You You're Smart [ASMR] feat. Dalia Gebrial.mp3
item.description: Amazing how Titania McGrath, a fictional account that owns Millennials by making dad jokes, is the talk of the London Media. It's almost like the account is run by two middle-aged Tories whose friends all RT them out of a sense of obligation. This week, Riley, Milo, and Nate speak with Novara Media's Dalia Gebrial ( @daliagebrial ) about the Titania McGrath 'phenomenon,' and why it speaks to the deeply conservative cornerstones of horniness and hurt feelings. *COMEDY KLAXON*: On April 10 at The Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA), two of the most profoundly funny voices in British comedy (and members of the Balthasar Speedboat cast), Pierre Novellie and Alex Kealy, will perform at Smoke Comedy. The show starts at 8 pm; tickets are £5 and can be purchased here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-pierre-novellie-and-alex-kealy-tickets-58849486398?aff=erelexpmlt

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190322 - Riley's Commie Book Club_ Mark Fisher.mp3
item.description: It’s that time again: Riley sat down with a book, and now you have to hear him talk about it for an hour or so. This month, Riley read K-Punk, out now on Repeater Books. K-Punk collects the previously unpublished writing of British left cultural, political, and social critic Mark Fisher, who explored realism and imagination, future and memory, and the freedom to imagine better worlds.

Well, as it just so happens, there are clearly enough Bill-lievers to necessitate an annual philanthropy fanzine, which we managed to get a hold of. Recorded live at the Star of Kings, this episode features friend of the show and founding member Charlie Palmer, a strung-together sound system, the errant noises of Nate crouching behind the DJ booth to eat a burger, and much more. Thank you so much to all the real heads who came out to see us live! *COMEDY KLAXON*: On March 13 at 8pm, Milo will host another Smoke Comedy at the Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA). item.title: Hostile Environment for Flip Phones feat. Victor Patrascan
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190216 - Hostile Environment for Flip Phones feat. Victor Patrascan.mp3
item.description: Does it surprise anyone that the Tories would decide that the issue of EU citizens in the UK could be solved with an app? And does it surprise anyone that that app doesn't work? In this week's bonus episode, comedian Victor Patrascan — recently of Romania — joins the Trashfuture crew to discuss the Samsung-only immigration policy. We also discuss a very dumb article about Vene-freaking-zuela. This episode features a TF first: reporting segments that Hussein and Nate conducted —featuring Maria Llorente from the EU citizens' advocacy group The 3 Million, and with Chicago-based app developer Ryan Jones — because guess what, folks? We've invented the news. *LIVE SHOW ALERT* We have an upcoming live show -- with comedian Josie Long -- in London on February 21st at the Star of Kings (126 York Way, Kings Cross, London N1 0AX) starting at 7.30 pm. You can buy tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/trashfuture-live-ft-josie-long-tickets-54546538164 *COMEDY KLAXON* On 27th February at 8 pm, Elf Lyons and a number of other comics will perform at Smoke Comedy at the Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA). item.description: On this week's bonus episode, we're taking you to a brain expansion dimension that you've never visited before. Riley, Hussein, Milo, and Alice join special guest George Eaton, deputy editor at the New Statesman for a discussion of the HBO / Channel 4 feature film 'Brexit' starring Benedict Cumberbatch as Dominic Cummings. Sure, it's bad, but is that really so surprising? We delve into it with the keen insights that you've come to expect from us. *LIVE SHOW ALERT* We have an upcoming live show -- with comedian Josie Long -- in London on February 21st at the Star of Kings (126 York Way, Kings Cross, London N1 0AX) starting at 7.30 pm. item.title: The Blurst Is Yet to Come feat. Peter Fleming
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190120 - The Blurst Is Yet to Come feat. Peter Fleming.mp3
item.description: In this week's bonus, Riley's Commie Book Club is a bit different. This time, Riley speaks with scholar and author Peter Fleming — you might recognize the name from a previous episode discussing his book 'The Death of Homo Economicus' — and this time they cover the subject of Peter's new book, 'The Worst Is Yet to Come: A Post-Capitalist Survival Guide.' Peter Fleming is a professor at the University of London and the University of Technology, Sydney. He is the author of several books, including The Mythology of Work (2015) and The Death of Homo Economicus (2017). His writing has appeared in the Guardian and Financial Times. Peter stayed up late in Australia in order to have a lively discussion with your delightful host, and we're greatly appreciative of him. You should buy Peter's book, and you can do so here: https://repeaterbooks.com/product/the-worst-is-yet-to-come-a-post-capitalist-survival-guide/

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20190120 - The Blurst Is Yet to Come feat. Peter Fleming.mp3

item.description: In this week's bonus episode, Nate interviews writer and extreme Trashfuture Tolerator Edie Miller (@multiplebears) about her recent article in the Outline, in which she asks a crucial question: why is UK media so transphobic? Their discussion covers the strangeness of the TERF argument, the weird way in which it has more currency among liberals in the UK than in the US, and much more. You can read Edie's article here: https://theoutline.com/post/6536/british-feminists-media-transphobic?zd=1&zi=utvxehpk Also, make sure you buy a t-shirt from Lil' Comrade: https://www.lilcomrade.com/

item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181228 - Why to Care About Politics feat. Aidan 'Taco' Jones.mp3
item.description: So, this episode was a long time coming. Riley, Milo, and Aidan 'Taco' Jones recorded this during Edinburgh Fringe, but it's been on the back-burner for a while. Now that we're in the beloved dead space between Christmas and the New Year, we saw fit to release it. Regale yourself with a conversation in which Riley explains why you should care about politics. If you're blessed with holidays from work, hope they're good. And if not, well, neither does our producer.

However, before we could get there, we had to read our beloved boy Toby Young's insane holiday column about his 'vertiginous' 'defenestration' from public life. We did our best to answer your questions with a minimum of Yu Gi Oh references. Well, a relative minimum. item.title: Riley's Festive Commie Book Club: 'The End of the Transition Paradigm'
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181213 - Riley's Festive Commie Book Club_ 'The End of the Transition Paradigm'.mp3
item.description: For this week's particularly festive bonus, Riley reviews the academic paper 'The End of the Transition Paradigm' by Thomas Carothers. Riley discusses international relations as a discipline, his takes on some core assumptions of the genre, how it's influenced modern politics in the general Atlantic region, and much more. You can read the article in its entirety here: https://www.journalofdemocracy.org/sites/default/files/Carothers-13-1.pdf and then tell Riley why, actually, he's wrong.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181213 - Riley's Festive Commie Book Club_ 'The End of the Transition Paradigm'.mp3

item.title: Trashfuture Presents: Balthasar Speedboat
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181204 - Trashfuture Presents_ Balthasar Speedboat.mp3
item.description: This week's bonus episode of Trashfuture is actually a pilot of sorts -- it's a comedy show we've assembled featuring an ensemble cast of Milo, Riley, Olga Koch (@rocknrolga), Pierre Novellie ( @pierrenovellie), Alex Kealy (@alexkealy), and a few bits from Nate as well. It's a show about how to feel the snow in a sensual way, assigned names for criminals, Dilbert-esque porn banter, Adam Sandler's comedic oeuvre, and Nate discussing a repressed memory about a German magazine he read as a kid that depicted a very silly dog. If you enjoy this, please let us know! We're on the fence about whether or not to do another one... which makes you our partners in podcasting.

item.title: Idiocracy Was a Damn Documentary! feat. Adam Rensch
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181029 - Idiocracy Was a Damn Documentary! feat. Adam Rensch.mp3
item.description: This is of course something of a new content type: on this week's bonus episode, Riley, Milo, Nate, and Olga (@rocknrolga) join Adam Rensch (@nachdermas) — host of the Stop/Rewind podcast — to discuss a film that burrowed itself into the American liberal worldview like a hideous, parasitical worm. That film? Idiocracy, the 2006 Mike Judge comedy that frankly sucks, but more on an ethical level than you might expect. Have you ever wanted to do Death of the Author on a shitty movie? You'd better have! You can check out Adam's podcast here: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/stop-rewind/id1434852449 Also, don't forget that our live show at the Sekforde in London is coming up very soon! Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/trashfuture-live-halloween-spooktacular-tickets-51361920888

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - For a Left Populism
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181022 - Riley's Commie Book Club - For a Left Populism.mp3
item.description: This week's bonus is Riley's Commie Book Club, reviewing Chantal Mouffe's "For a Left Populism. Why are we constantly told that the status quo — i.e. neoliberal market economics — is the natural order? Why does the centre hate socialism more than fascism? Why is it a bad thing that socialism might leave the absolute wealthiest on the planet worse off than they are in our current gilded age? And why do they want to live in orbiting space stations? Listen to this episode to answer all these questions, and more.

enclosure.url: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181022 - Riley's Commie Book Club - For a Left Populism.mp3

item.title: EDM: Sonic Gentrification feat. Aloiso Wilmoth
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20181001 - EDM_ Sonic Gentrification feat. Aloiso Wilmoth.mp3
item.description: Welcome to this week's bonus episode from Riley. You've been promised this for ages and now you're getting it: a discussion on techno as praxis. But, it's not as lame as that might sound, because Riley speaks with musician and producer Aloiso Wilmoth ( @HE_VALENCIA) about the history of techno, its DIY ethos, its Midwest American roots, and how's it's been repackaged and sold as EDM. You can find Aloiso's music on SoundCloud here: https://soundcloud.com/he_valencian There's a little bit of warble on the recording! We've done our best to clean it up as much as possible, but you may still notice it periodically.

item.title: The New \"You're-A-Pee-in'\" feat. Matt Zarb-Cousin
item.link: https://ankino.xyz/trashfuture/20180924 - The New _You're-A-Pee-in'_ feat. Matt Zarb-Cousin.mp3
item.description: On this week's bonus episode, Riley, Milo, and Nate sit down with former Jeremy Corbyn spokesman and extremely cool friend of the show Matt Zarb-Cousin (@mattzarb) to discuss the New European, 'a magazine for the 48 per cent.' As you might not be surprised to discover, it's actually the slightly more genteel version of those people with bitmoji avatars and 13 different hashtags in their name who always, always reply to Brexit tweets. Make sure to listen to the end for some excellent, excellent singing on the part of the lads, who learned from this episode to drink a lot less when recording. Thank you so much for your support of our show! We're really excited about all the new premium content that we're planning to bring out, and we couldn't do this without you.

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club: The Death of Homo Economicus by Peter Fleming

item.description: In our first-ever Patreon subscriber bonus, you get to hear Riley's Commie Book Club review of yet another publication. Feel free to leave a comment here if there's a book you want our avid reader (and hairy son) to review in the future.
